Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileSystem
  • public class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a file system managing directories and files. Allows for operations such as changing directories, listing contents, creating, deleting, moving files and directories, and searching within the file system.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FileSystem()
      Constructor for the FileSystem.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean changeDirectory​(java.lang.String path)
      Changes the current directory to a new directory specified by the path.
      void createFileOrDirectory​(java.lang.String type, java.lang.String name)
      Creates a file or directory in the current directory based on the type specified.
      void deleteFileOrDirectory​(java.lang.String name)
      Deletes a file or directory by name in the current directory.
      void deleteRecursively​(FileSystemElement element)
      Recursively deletes a file system element.
      Directory getCurrentDirectory()
      Returns the current directory within the file system.
      java.lang.String getCurrentPath()
      Returns the path of the current directory.
      void listContents()
      Lists all files and directories in the current directory.
      void moveFileOrDirectory​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String newPath)
      Moves a file or directory to a new path.
      void printCurrentDirectoryTree()
      Prints the directory tree from the root to the current directory.
      void printDirectoryTree​(Directory dir, java.lang.String indent)
      Prints the directory tree starting from a given directory with a specified indentation.
      void search​(java.lang.String name, Directory startDir)
      Searches for a file or directory by name starting from the specified directory.
      void sortDirectoryByDate​(Directory dir)
      Sorts the contents of a directory by the date they were created.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileSystem

        public FileSystem()
        Constructor for the FileSystem. Initializes the file system with a root directory.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentDirectory

        public Directory getCurrentDirectory()
        Returns the current directory within the file system.
        Returns:
        The current directory.

      • changeDirectory

        public boolean changeDirectory​(java.lang.String path)
        Changes the current directory to a new directory specified by the path. Supports absolute and relative paths.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the new directory.
        Returns:
        true if the directory change is successful, false otherwise.

      • listContents

        public void listContents()
        Lists all files and directories in the current directory.

      • createFileOrDirectory

        public void createFileOrDirectory​(java.lang.String type,
                                  java.lang.String name)
        Creates a file or directory in the current directory based on the type specified.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the file system element to create ('f' for file, 'd' for directory).
        name - The name of the file or directory to create.

      • deleteRecursively

        public void deleteRecursively​(FileSystemElement element)
        Recursively deletes a file system element.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to delete.

      • deleteFileOrDirectory

        public void deleteFileOrDirectory​(java.lang.String name)
        Deletes a file or directory by name in the current directory.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the file or directory to delete.

      • moveFileOrDirectory

        public void moveFileOrDirectory​(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String newPath)
        Moves a file or directory to a new path.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the file or directory to move.
        newPath - The new path for the file or directory.

      • search

        public void search​(java.lang.String name,
                   Directory startDir)
        Searches for a file or directory by name starting from the specified directory.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to search for.
        startDir - The starting directory for the search.

      • printDirectoryTree

        public void printDirectoryTree​(Directory dir,
                               java.lang.String indent)
        Prints the directory tree starting from a given directory with a specified indentation.
        Parameters:
        dir - The starting directory.
        indent - The indentation to use for each level of the tree.

      • printCurrentDirectoryTree

        public void printCurrentDirectoryTree()
        Prints the directory tree from the root to the current directory.

      • sortDirectoryByDate

        public void sortDirectoryByDate​(Directory dir)
        Sorts the contents of a directory by the date they were created.
        Parameters:
        dir - The directory whose contents will be sorted.

      • getCurrentPath

        public java.lang.String getCurrentPath()
        Returns the path of the current directory.
        Returns:
        The path of the current directory.
